b2b.label: B2B SaaS PM
assumptions: You are PM for a B2B SaaS product.
Your squad is 6 engineers, 1 designer, and a shared analyst.
You can choose one primary action first, not both.
Unless stated otherwise, horizon is the next 4-8 weeks.

questions.prompt: Activation dropped from 52% to 35% after a new onboarding flow. The CEO wants recovery evidence before the next monthly business review in 4 weeks, and engineering can only do one medium-sized project this sprint.

A.label: Roll back the riskiest onboarding step now and ship friction fixes from known support tickets this sprint.

B.label: Keep the new flow, run targeted user interviews plus event audit this week, and ship a root-cause fix next sprint.

questions.prompt: You are seeing weekly reliability incidents caused by API latency. Sales has already committed three enterprise integrations worth major pipeline this quarter.

A.label: Reserve meaningful capacity now for reliability work and renegotiate integration dates.

B.label: Deliver integrations first and schedule reliability remediation next quarter.

questions.prompt: A large renewal is at risk unless you support a custom approval workflow. Product strategy says avoid one-off enterprise features, and leadership is split.

A.label: Run a decision session with CRO, Product, and Engineering using a shared rubric and decide from that process.

B.label: Make the call immediately based on strategy fit and communicate rationale asynchronously.

questions.prompt: Ninety-day retention has been flat for two quarters. You have solid event data but no recent qualitative research from churned or power users.

A.label: Run a short discovery sprint with interviews and journey mapping before changing roadmap priorities.

B.label: Ship the top two retention interventions from current telemetry immediately and measure lift.

questions.prompt: Mid-quarter budget cuts remove 35% of your discretionary spend. You can protect only one track: long-term platform migration or near-term monetization improvements.

A.label: Protect platform migration because it unlocks future product expansion.

B.label: Pause migration and focus on immediate monetization and upsell gains.

questions.prompt: Engineering wants a backend rewrite for scalability, while Design wants iterative UX improvements for current conversion problems. You must present a committed plan by Friday.

A.label: Facilitate a structured tradeoff workshop with objective criteria, then commit.

B.label: Choose one path now from strategic priorities and lock the plan today.

questions.prompt: Competitors just launched an AI copilot and your GTM team wants parity in 6 weeks. Your internal data quality is still uneven.

A.label: Run a concierge prototype with a small design-partner set to validate jobs-to-be-done first.

B.label: Ship a tightly scoped beta quickly to avoid narrative gap, then learn from usage.

questions.prompt: You have a major conference launch slot in 5 weeks. The build works for happy paths but edge-case failures affect about 8% of target users.

A.label: Launch a limited version at conference and harden rapidly after launch.

B.label: Skip conference launch and release later with stronger reliability.

questions.prompt: A production outage came from combined decisions across product and infrastructure. Team leads disagree on ownership for prevention work.

A.label: Assign a single accountable owner immediately and enforce deadlines.

B.label: Run a joint postmortem first, define RACI and prevention plan, then assign owners.

questions.prompt: A feature launched 8 weeks ago is used weekly by only 12% of its target accounts. Leadership wants a turnaround plan in 10 days.

A.label: Investigate workflow mismatch through interviews and replays, and potentially reposition the feature.

B.label: Push adoption now through onboarding prompts, lifecycle messaging, and packaging or pricing experiments.

b2c.label: B2C Consumer PM
assumptions: You are PM for a consumer mobile app with around 2M MAU.
Your squad is 6 engineers, 1 designer, and a shared data scientist.
You can choose one primary action first, not both.
Unless stated otherwise, horizon is the next 4-8 weeks.

questions.prompt: Seven-day retention dropped from 31% to 24% after an onboarding redesign. Paid acquisition ramps in 2 weeks, and engineering can do only one medium change this sprint.

A.label: Roll back the riskiest onboarding step now and ship quick drop-off fixes.

B.label: Keep the new flow, run cohort and session analysis plus interviews, then ship a root-cause fix next sprint.

questions.prompt: Notification frequency can move from two per week to daily. Forecast: +5% DAU, but +1.5% weekly opt-outs and +0.4% uninstall risk.

A.label: Launch higher frequency with guardrails to capture engagement upside.

B.label: Keep cadence lower and improve relevance quality before increasing sends.

questions.prompt: A top creator wants moderation exceptions. Policy says no, Partnerships says losing them hurts growth. You need a decision in 48 hours.

A.label: Run a structured cross-functional decision session and align on a shared rubric.

B.label: Make the call immediately based on platform principles and communicate it today.

questions.prompt: A new Collections feature gets 18% trial but only 6% repeat usage by week 2. Telemetry exists, but user intent is unclear.

A.label: Run a rapid discovery sprint with interviews or diary study before changing roadmap bets.

B.label: Ship usage nudges, templates, and in-app prompts now to increase repeat behavior.

questions.prompt: Quarterly revenue needs plus 12% ARPDAU. Adding one ad slot is estimated to deliver plus 14% revenue but minus 3% session length.

A.label: Add the ad slot and monitor churn and retention thresholds.

B.label: Keep ad load stable and pursue lower-friction monetization paths first.

questions.prompt: Design wants a navigation revamp. Engineering prefers incremental fixes due to regression risk. Release window closes in 10 days.

A.label: Facilitate a tradeoff workshop with objective criteria, then commit jointly.

B.label: Choose a direction now and lock sprint scope immediately.

questions.prompt: A competitor launched a streak mechanic and social chatter is strong. You can either validate impact first or ship quickly.

A.label: Run a two-week prototype with target cohorts to verify retention impact.

B.label: Ship a lean streak version in three weeks and learn from live usage.

questions.prompt: Moving the paywall earlier is modeled to increase conversion plus 9% but reduce week-1 engagement by 7%.

A.label: Move paywall earlier to hit conversion and revenue targets.

B.label: Keep paywall later and improve value perception before gating.

questions.prompt: A public safety incident is trending. Trust and Safety, Comms, and Product each propose different immediate actions.

A.label: Align teams in a war-room first, define owners and criteria, then execute.

B.label: Make one immediate accountable decision and drive execution top-down.

questions.prompt: Thirty-day churn is high on mid-tier Android devices; complaints mention slow load and unclear value. Next growth spend starts in 10 days.

A.label: Pause spend, diagnose root causes with performance traces and user calls, then reprioritize.

B.label: Keep spend live and ship quick win-back and onboarding interventions now.
